name: Fixpath
tagline: A handy script to fix PATH issues, like repeated or unwanted entries.
body:
## Motivation.
**fixpath** is a set of scripts to fix the order and remove repeated and unwanted entries
in the _PATH_ or _MANPATH_.  It was originally intended to deal with issues in X11 terminals on Mac OS 10.8 for [Fink](http://www.finkproject.org "Fink"),  but could easily be adapted for other scenarios.

To illustrate this, here are what the _PATH_ environment variable shows up as on my Mountain Lion system.

### OS X "native" terminal
```
$ printenv PATH
/sw/lib/perl5/ExtUtils:/sw/bin:/sw/sbin:
/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin:/usr/local/bin:
/opt/X11/bin:/Users/hansen/bin
```
### X11 terminal
```
$ printenv PATH
/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/opt/X11/bin:
/sw/lib/perl5/ExtUtils:/sw/bin:/sw/sbin:/Users/hansen/bin
```

For the sake of consistency, I'd prefer to have the same _PATH_ regardless of what terminal I'm using, and so I created the **fixpath** tool.
